subtitle: [Music]
New Thinking Allowed. Conversations on the
leading edge
of knowledge and discovery with
parapsychologist
Jeffrey Mishlove.
Hello, and welcome. I'm Jeffrey Mishlove. I'd
like to talk to you today
about some new directions for the New
Thinking Allowed channel. You know, my
wife, Janelle Barlow, is an expert in
branding. She's
the author of Branded Customer Service,
and several other business books,
including Emotional Value, and
the business bestseller, A Complaint
is a Gift.
So, Janelle understands things about
branding that I don't understand. I'm
not nearly as active in the world of
business as she is.
But New Thinking Allowed has become a
brand really, and one of the things that
Janelle tells me
is that a brand is defined by
and belongs to the users,
the customers, you. Those of you who are
watching right now
are really the ones involved in creating
this brand, and
we're at a point now where we have over
82,000 subscribers on this channel. We get
approximately
9,000 to 10,000 viewers every day.
Last February, I issued a call.
After five years, I issued a call for
volunteers. I thought I
had been carrying this whole thing on my
shoulders, and I thought,
if I had a little help, what could we do?
And amazing things have happened
as a result of the volunteers. We have over
300 volunteers. They've transcribed
all of the “In Presence” monologues
and many of the interviews.
They're also working, and let me issue a
call right now, for those of you who want
to pitch in,
we can use more transcribers. In
particular,
what we'd like to do is take those
edited transcripts and go back
to the YouTube automated
captions and correct them, because the
automated captions have, I don't know,
10% or 5% errors.
The reason why it's so important for
us right now
to have those captions error-free
is because we use them in a brand new
database, which is about to be unveiled I
should think within just a couple of weeks. I've
been working with it now for a few
months, and it's wonderful.
We have a searchable
database. That means you can put in any
search term, and it will show you where
on each of our videos that term is discussed.
In fact, we've even wrapped in all of the
videos from the original
Thinking Allowed series, which has a
separate YouTube channel.
Those are videos that ran from 1986
to 2002. They're mostly video excerpts,
but they're all included in our
searchable database.
In terms of our future growth and
development, we are soon
going to be reaching out to our
guests on the program and all the
organizations with which
they are affiliated, and all of the
YouTube channels that are moving in the
same direction
as New Thinking Allowed, to include their
videos
in our searchable database. So, any time
you have a
search term, it could be poltergeist, it
could be egregores,
it could be telepathy or precognition,
you would be able to go directly to the places
in all of the videos in the database where
that term is discussed.
So, volunteers are important
in terms of editing transcripts. We've
been translating into
over a dozen different foreign languages
to reach out,
but there are many other things
that we are doing right now to reach out
to the community
of viewers. For example, we are now
publishing
a weekly newsletter. We've been doing it for 19
weeks, and if you wish to subscribe
to that newsletter, you can do that by
sending me an email to Friends@
NewThinkingAllowed.com. Eventually,
when the new website is active, which
won't be very long,
you just go to newthinkingallowed.org, the
New Thinking Allowed Foundation.
You'll be able to subscribe to our
newsletter there.
Another development that we're working
on are live streams. We've started doing live
stream videos
with guests and live stream videos with
just me,
handling your toughest questions. I love
doing it,
as a matter of fact. And the guests who
have done the live streams
love doing them as well. It gives
those of you who are viewers
an opportunity to interact more directly
than just watching the video.
We're also looking at the possibility of
establishing
educational credits, maybe college credits, maybe
continuing education credits, maybe just
a certificate.
For example, if you were able to choose,
let us say,
15 hours worth of content on the New
Thinking
Allowed channel from our hundreds of
videos, selecting those that are of
interest to you,
and then writing a term paper after
you finished digesting
all of those videos, you might be able to
get college credit for that. We're
exploring that option right now.
We're also looking at building a
coalition, using our searchable database
as the foundation for building
a coalition of related YouTube channels, related
organizations, because united we are
stronger.
And the possibility of, for example, we
actually have amongst our volunteers
some grant writers, so we're looking
at how we can
become a little bit more of an
institution, a little bit more of a permanent,
solid organization, not just something
that I'm
funding out of my own wallet.
I should mention a few other things.
YouTube
itself has now made available
the possibility of memberships.
YouTube will charge a fee. We can set
a fee. YouTube keeps 30%,
they'll give us 70%. I
don't know about it.
My philosophy up until now has pretty
much been, give as much away for free
as you can. And I know people are hurting
because of the pandemic
and because of economic issues. But
on the other hand, we have over 80,000
subscribers.
Some of you might feel that it's very
justifiable
to pay us a dollar a month or $10
a month, or
if you can, $100 a month. But
we're thinking about it, we're contemplating what
sorts of value can we provide for
members, if we were to structure
memberships on YouTube. I would like to
hear from viewers, and you can write to me
at Friends@NewThinkingAllowed.com.
What would motivate you to
subscribe to a membership on our channel?
Why would you want to do that?
What would you like to get back in return
for your membership? I'd be very happy to
hear from you.
Of course, the wonderful thing about
the volunteers,
and I encourage anyone who is listening
to this now to consider volunteering,
the volunteers have been coming up with
ideas for developments that would not have
occurred to me. It wouldn't have occurred to
me to do live stream
events, which have proven to be very
popular.
It wouldn't have occurred to me to put
out a weekly
newsletter, which I think is a
great idea. Incidentally, if you subscribe
to the weekly newsletter,
what you get is sort of an advance, sneak
preview of the
videos that will be released in the
coming week.
Undoubtedly, there are many more things.
Many of you have noticed that we have
new music,
we have new graphics. We've been
blessed with volunteers who have used their
own creativity to create various, highly produced
trailers to promote some of our videos.
And there are a number of magazines that
are actually publishing
our edited transcripts. So, I'm very
excited about all of these developments.
Our membership is
growing at a nice clip, and I expect that
that will continue
for some time. I want to thank
those of you who have been contributing.
I'm so grateful for the support we're
getting
from all the volunteers. And I want to
make the opportunity available for those
of you who didn't know about volunteers, because
maybe you subscribed
recently, to consider yourself
part of our community. If you want
to pitch in
and get to know the other volunteers,
I invite you to do that. Again,
you can do that by writing to me at
friends@newthinkingallowed.com
So, I'll leave you with this
question.
If you were to consider contributing to
something like
New Thinking Allowed, if you were to do
that, what would be your contribution? How
could you contribute,
and why do you think you should or might?
I'll leave you with those thoughts, and
thank you
for being with me.
[Music]
